Song.title: Come Thou Fount
Song.copyright: Words, Music by Robert Robinson Arr. by T. Lively Fluharty

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [D] [G] [D] [G] [D] [G] [D]
VERSE 1: Come Thou [D]Fount of every [A]blessing, [D/F#]Tune my [G]heart to [G/A]sing Thy [D]Grace Streams of [D]mercy never [A]ceasing, [D/F#]Call for [G]songs of [G/A]loudest [D]praise [A/C#]Teach me [Bm]some melodious [D/A]sonnet, Sung by [G]flaming [D/F#]tongues a[Em]bove Praise the [D]mount! I'm fixed u[A]pon it, [D/F#]Mount of [G]Thy re[G/A]deeming [D]love [G | D | A ]
VERSE 2: Hither[D]to Thy love has [A]blest me, [D/F#]Thou hast [G]brought me [G/A]to this [D]place And I [D]know Thy hand will [A]bring me, [D/F#]Safely [G]home by [G/A]Thy good [D]grace [A/C#]Jesus [Bm]sought me when a [D/A]stranger, Wandering [G]from the [D/F#]fold of [Em]God He to [D]rescue me from [A]danger, [D/F#]Inter[G]posed His [G/A]precious [D]blood [G | D | A ]
{new_page} VERSE 3: [A]O to [D]grace how great a [A]debtor; [D/F#]Daily [G]I'm con[G/A]strained to [D]be Let Thy [D]goodness like a [A]fetter, [D/F#]Bind my [G]wandering [G/A]heart to [D]Thee [A/C#]Prone to [Bm]wander, Lord I [D/A]feel it, Prone to [G]leave the [D/F#]God I [Em]love Here's my [D]heart, O take and [A]seal it, [D/F#]Seal it [G]for Thy [G/A]courts a[D]bove [G | D | A ]
VERSE 4: [A]O that [D]day when freed from [A]sinning, [D/F#]I shall [G]see Thy [G/A]lovely [D]face; Clothed [D]then in blood-washed [A]linen, [D/F#]How I'll [G]sing Thy [G/A]sovereign [D]grace; [A/C#]Come, my [Bm]Lord, no longer [D/A]tarry, Take my [G]ransomed [D/F#]soul a[Em]way; Send Thine [D]angels now to [A]carry [D/F#]Me to [G]realms of [G/A]endless [D]day [G | D | A ]
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 come thou fount of every blessing tune my heart to sing thy grace streams of mercy never ceasing call for songs of loudest praise teach me some melodious sonnet sung by flaming tongues above praise the mount im fixed upon it mount of thy redeeming love verse 2 hitherto thy love has blest me thou hast brought me to this place and i know thy hand will bring me safely home by thy good grace jesus sought me when a stranger wandering from the fold of god he to rescue me from danger interposed his precious blood verse 3 o to grace how great a debtor daily im constrained to be let thy goodness like a fetter bind my wandering heart to thee prone to wander lord i feel it prone to leave the god i love heres my heart o take and seal it seal it for thy courts above verse 4 o that day when freed from sinning i shall see thy lovely face clothed then in bloodwashed linen how ill sing thy sovereign grace come my lord no longer tarry take my ransomed soul away send thine angels now to carry me to realms of endless day

Arrangement.text:
VERSE 1: Come Thou [D]Fount of every [A]blessing, tune my [G]heart to [A]sing Thy [D]Grace [A]Streams of [D]mercy never [A]ceasing, call for [G]songs of [A]loudest [D]praise Teach me [D]some melodious sonnet, sung by flaming tongues above [A]Praise the [D]mount! I'm fixed u[A]pon it, [D/F#] Mount of [G]Thy re[A]deeming [D]love [Dsus D Dsus]
VERSE 2: I was [D]lost in utter [A]darkness 'til You [G]came and [A]rescued [D]me [A]I was [D]bound by all my [A]sin when Your love [G]came and [A]set me [D]free Now my [D]soul can sing a new song, now my heart has found a home [A]Now Your [D]grace is always [A]with me, [D/F#]and I'll [G]never be a- [D]lone
VERSE 3: O to grace how great a debtor daily I'm con strained to be Let Thy goodness like a fetter, bind my wandering heart to Thee Prone to wander, Lord I feel it, prone to leave the God I love Here's my heart, O take and seal it, seal it for Thy courts a bove
VERSE 4: O that [D]day when freed from [A]sinning, I shall [G]see Thy [A]lovely [D]face; [A]Clothed [D]then in blood-washed [A]linen, how I'll [G]sing Thy [A]sovereign [D]grace; Come, my [D]Lord, no longer tarry, bring Thy promises to pass; [A]For I [D]know Thy pow'r will [A]keep me [D/F#]till I'm [G]home with [A]Thee at [D]last
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 come thou fount of every blessing tune my heart to sing thy grace streams of mercy never ceasing call for songs of loudest praise teach me some melodious sonnet sung by flaming tongues above praise the mount im fixed upon it mount of thy redeeming love verse 2 i was lost in utter darkness til you came and rescued me i was bound by all my sin when your love came and set me free now my soul can sing a new song now my heart has found a home now your grace is always with me and ill never be a lone verse 3 o to grace how great a debtor daily im con strained to be let thy goodness like a fetter bind my wandering heart to thee prone to wander lord i feel it prone to leave the god i love heres my heart o take and seal it seal it for thy courts a bove verse 4 o that day when freed from sinning i shall see thy lovely face clothed then in bloodwashed linen how ill sing thy sovereign grace come my lord no longer tarry bring thy promises to pass for i know thy powr will keep me till im home with thee at last

Arrangement.description: Come Thou Fount, Come Thou King (verse changeup)
Arrangement.text:
Intro: [D] [Dsus] [D] [Dsus]
VERSE 1: Come Thou [D]Fount of every [A]blessing, tune my [G]heart to [A]sing Thy [D]Grace [A]Streams of [D]mercy never [A]ceasing, call for [G]songs of [A]loudest [D]praise Teach me [D]some melodious sonnet, sung by flaming tongues above [A]Praise the [D]mount! I'm fixed u[A]pon it, [D/F#] Mount of [G]Thy re[A]deeming [D]love [Dsus D Dsus]
CHORUS: Come Thou [G]Fount, come Thou [D]King Come Thou [G]precious Prince of [D]Peace Hear your [Bm7]Bride, to You we [G]sing Come Thou [A]Fount of our bles[D]sing.
VERSE 2: I was [D]lost in utter [A]darkness 'til You [G]came and [A]rescued [D]me [A]I was [D]bound by all my [A]sin when Your love [G]came and [A]set me [D]free Now my [D]soul can sing a new song, now my heart has found a home [A]Now Your [D]grace is always [A]with me, [D/F#]and I'll [G]never be a- [D]lone
VERSE 3: O that [D]day when freed from [A]sinning, I shall [G]see Thy [A]lovely [D]face; [A]Clothed [D]then in blood-washed [A]linen, how I'll [G]sing Thy [A]sovereign [D]grace; Come, my [D]Lord, no longer tarry, bring Thy promises to pass; [A]For I [D]know Thy pow'r will [A]keep me [D/F#]till I'm [G]home with [A]Thee at [D]last
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 come thou fount of every blessing tune my heart to sing thy grace streams of mercy never ceasing call for songs of loudest praise teach me some melodious sonnet sung by flaming tongues above praise the mount im fixed upon it mount of thy redeeming love chorus come thou fount come thou king come thou precious prince of peace hear your bride to you we sing come thou fount of our blessing verse 2 i was lost in utter darkness til you came and rescued me i was bound by all my sin when your love came and set me free now my soul can sing a new song now my heart has found a home now your grace is always with me and ill never be a lone verse 3 o that day when freed from sinning i shall see thy lovely face clothed then in bloodwashed linen how ill sing thy sovereign grace come my lord no longer tarry bring thy promises to pass for i know thy powr will keep me till im home with thee at last

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [D] [G] [D] [G] [D] [G] [D]
VERSE 1: [A]Come Thou [D]Fount of [D/F#]every [A]blessing, [D/F#]Tune my [G]heart to [A]sing Thy [D]Grace [A]Streams of [D]mercy [D/F#]never [A]ceasing, [D/F#]Call for [G]songs of [A]loudest [D]praise [A]Teach me [Bm]some me[G]lodious [D]sonnet, [A]Sung by [Bm]flaming [A]tongues a[G]bove [A]Praise the [D]mount! I'm fixed u[A]pon it, [D/F#]Mount of [G]Thy re[A]deeming [D]love [G D G D G D]
VERSE 2: [A]Hither[D]to Thy [D/F#]love has [A]blest me, [D/F#]Thou hast [G]brought me [A]to this [D]place [A]And I [D]know Thy [D/F#]hand will [A]bring me, [D/F#]Safely [G]home by [A]Thy good [D]grace [A]Jesus [Bm]sought me [G]when a [D]stranger, [A]Wandering [Bm]from the [A]fold of [G]God [A]He to [D]rescue me from [A]danger, [D/F#]Inter[G]posed His [A]precious [D]blood
{new_page} VERSE 3: [A]O to [D]grace how [D/F#]great a [A]debtor; [D/F#]Daily [G]I'm con[A]strained to [D]be [A]Let Thy [D]goodness [D/F#]like a [A]fetter, [D/F#]Bind my [G]wandering [A]heart to [D]Thee [A]Prone to [Bm]wander, [G]Lord I [D]feel it, [A]Prone to [Bm]leave the [A]God I [G]love [A]Here's my [D]heart, O take and [A]seal it, [D/F#]Seal it [G]for Thy [A]courts a[D]bove
VERSE 4: [A]O that [D]day when [D/F#]freed from [A]sinning, [D/F#]I shall [G]see Thy [A]lovely [D]face; [A]Clothed [D]then in [D/F#]blood-washed [A]linen, [D/F#]How I'll [G]sing Thy [A]sovereign [D]grace; [A]Come, my [Bm]Lord, no [G]longer [D]tarry, [A]Take my [Bm]ransomed [A]soul a[G]way; [A]Send Thine [D]angels now to [A]carry [D/F#]Me to [G]realms of [A]endless [D]day
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 come thou fount of every blessing tune my heart to sing thy grace streams of mercy never ceasing call for songs of loudest praise teach me some melodious sonnet sung by flaming tongues above praise the mount im fixed upon it mount of thy redeeming love verse 2 hitherto thy love has blest me thou hast brought me to this place and i know thy hand will bring me safely home by thy good grace jesus sought me when a stranger wandering from the fold of god he to rescue me from danger interposed his precious blood verse 3 o to grace how great a debtor daily im constrained to be let thy goodness like a fetter bind my wandering heart to thee prone to wander lord i feel it prone to leave the god i love heres my heart o take and seal it seal it for thy courts above verse 4 o that day when freed from sinning i shall see thy lovely face clothed then in bloodwashed linen how ill sing thy sovereign grace come my lord no longer tarry take my ransomed soul away send thine angels now to carry me to realms of endless day

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [D Dsus4 D Dsus4]
VERSE 1: Come Thou [D]Fount of every [A]blessing, Tune my [G]heart to sing Thy [D]Grace Streams of [D]mercy never [A]ceasing, Call for [G]songs of loudest [D]praise [A]Teach me [Bm]some melodious [F#m]sonnet, Sung by [G]flaming tongues above Praise the [D]name! I'm fixed u[A]pon it, Name of [G]Thy redeeming [G]love[G/A | D | A | G | D]
VERSE 2: [A]Hither[D]to Thy love has [A]blest me, [D/F#]Thou hast [G]brought me [G/A]to this [Bm]pla[G]ce And I [D]know Thy hand will [A]bring me, Safely [G]home by [A]Thy good [D]grace [A]Jesus [D]sought me when a [A/C#]stranger, Wandering [G/B]from the fold of [D/F#]God [G]He, to [D]rescue me from [A]danger, Inter[G]posed His [A]precious [D]blood[|A | G | D]
{new_page} VERSE 3: O to [D]grace how great a [A/D]debtor; Daily [G/D]I'm constrained to [D]be [A]Let Thy [D]goodness like a [A/D]fetter, [D/F#]Bind my [G]wandering [A]heart to [Bm A G]Thee Prone to [Bm]wander, Lord I [F#m]feel it, Prone to [G]leave the God I [Em7]love [G/A]Here's my [D]heart, O take and [A]seal it, [D/F#]Seal it [G]for Thy [G/A]courts a[D]bove[|A | G | Bsus4 B]
{key:E} VERSE 4: O that [E]day when freed from [B]sinning, [E/G#]I shall [A]see Thy [B]lovely [E]face; [A/E]Full ar[E]rayed in blood-washed [B]linen, How I'll [A]sing Thy [Bsus]sovereign [C#m]grac[A]e; Come, my [C#m]Lord, no longer [B]tarry, Bring Thy [A]promises to [F#m7]pass [A/B]For I [E]know Thy power will [B]keep me [E/G#]Till I'm [A]home with [B]Thee at [E]last[|A | A | E]
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 come thou fount of every blessing tune my heart to sing thy grace streams of mercy never ceasing call for songs of loudest praise teach me some melodious sonnet sung by flaming tongues above praise the name im fixed upon it name of thy redeeming love verse 2 hitherto thy love has blest me thou hast brought me to this place and i know thy hand will bring me safely home by thy good grace jesus sought me when a stranger wandering from the fold of god he to rescue me from danger interposed his precious blood verse 3 o to grace how great a debtor daily im constrained to be let thy goodness like a fetter bind my wandering heart to thee prone to wander lord i feel it prone to leave the god i love heres my heart o take and seal it seal it for thy courts above verse 4 o that day when freed from sinning i shall see thy lovely face full arrayed in bloodwashed linen how ill sing thy sovereign grace come my lord no longer tarry bring thy promises to pass for i know thy power will keep me till im home with thee at last

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [D] [Bm] [G] [D]
VERSE 1: Come Thou [D]Fount of every blessing, Tune my [Bm]heart to sing Thy Grace Streams of [G]mercy never ceasing, Call for [D]songs of loudest praise Teach me [D]some melodious sonnet, Sung by [Bm]flaming tongues above Praise the [G]mount! I'm fixed upon it, Mount of [D]Thy redeeming love [D Bm G D]
VERSE 2: Hither[D]to Thy love has blest me, Thou hast [Bm]brought me to this place And I [G]know Thy hand will bring me, Safely [D]home by Thy good grace Jesus [D]sought me when a stranger, Wandering [Bm]from the fold of God He to [G]rescue me from danger, Inter[D]posed His precious blood
{new_page} VERSE 3: O to [D]grace how great a debtor; Daily [Bm]I'm constrained to be Let Thy [G]goodness like a fetter, Bind my [D]wandering heart to Thee Prone to [D]wander, Lord I feel it, Prone to [Bm]leave the God I love Here's my [G]heart, O take and seal it, Seal it [D]for Thy courts above
VERSE 4: O that [D]day when freed from sinning, I shall [Bm]see Thy lovely face; Clothed [G]then in blood-washed linen, How I'll [D]sing Thy sovereign grace; Come, my [D]Lord, no longer tarry, Take my [Bm]ransomed soul away; Send Thine [G]angels now to carry Me to [D]realms of endless day
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 come thou fount of every blessing tune my heart to sing thy grace streams of mercy never ceasing call for songs of loudest praise teach me some melodious sonnet sung by flaming tongues above praise the mount im fixed upon it mount of thy redeeming love verse 2 hitherto thy love has blest me thou hast brought me to this place and i know thy hand will bring me safely home by thy good grace jesus sought me when a stranger wandering from the fold of god he to rescue me from danger interposed his precious blood verse 3 o to grace how great a debtor daily im constrained to be let thy goodness like a fetter bind my wandering heart to thee prone to wander lord i feel it prone to leave the god i love heres my heart o take and seal it seal it for thy courts above verse 4 o that day when freed from sinning i shall see thy lovely face clothed then in bloodwashed linen how ill sing thy sovereign grace come my lord no longer tarry take my ransomed soul away send thine angels now to carry me to realms of endless day

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [Chord Run 4x]
VERSE 1: [D]Come Thou [D]Fount of every [A]blessing, Tune my [G]heart to [A]sing Thy [D]Grace [A]Streams of [D]mercy never [A]ceasing, Call for [G]songs of [A]loudest [D]praise Teach me [Bm]some melodious sonnet, Sung by [Bm]flaming [A]tongues a[G]bove Praise the [D]mount! I'm fixed u[A]pon it, Mount of [G]Thy re[A]deeming [D]love [2x Run]
VERSE 2: [A]Hither[D]to Thy love has [A]blest me, Thou hast [G]brought me [A]to this [D]place And I [D]know Thy hand will [A]bring me, Safely [G]home by [A]Thy good [D]grace Jesus [Bm]sought me when a stranger, Wandering [Bm]from the [A]fold of [G]God He to [D]rescue me from [A]danger, Inter[G]posed His [A]precious [D]blood [2x Run]
{new_page} VERSE 3: [A]O to [D]grace how great a [A]debtor; Daily [G]I'm con[A]strained to [D]be [A]Let Thy [D]goodness like a [A]fetter, Bind my [G]wandering [A]heart to [D]Thee Prone to [Bm]wander, Lord I feel it, Prone to [Bm]leave the [A]God I [G]love Here's my [D]heart, O take and [A]seal it, Seal it [G]for Thy [A]courts a[D]bove [2x Run]
VERSE 4: [A]O that [D]day when freed from [A]sinning, I shall [G]see Thy [A]lovely [D]face; [A]Clothed [D]then in blood-washed [A]linen, How I'll [G]sing Thy [A]sovereign [D]grace; [A]Come, my [Bm]Lord, no longer tarry, Take my [Bm]ransomed [A]soul a[G]way; Send Thine [D]angels now to [A]carry Me to [G]realms of [A]endless [D]day [4x Run]
{new_page} Tag: Jesus [Bm]sought me when a stranger, Wandering [Bm]from the [A]fold of [G]God He to [D]rescue me from [A]danger, Inter[G]posed His [A]precious [D]blood [Chord Run 4x]
Tag B: Interposed His precious Interposed His precious Interposed His precious Holy Blood[4x]
Ending-[Chord Run 4x]
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 come thou fount of every blessing tune my heart to sing thy grace streams of mercy never ceasing call for songs of loudest praise teach me some melodious sonnet sung by flaming tongues above praise the mount im fixed upon it mount of thy redeeming love verse 2 hitherto thy love has blest me thou hast brought me to this place and i know thy hand will bring me safely home by thy good grace jesus sought me when a stranger wandering from the fold of god he to rescue me from danger interposed his precious blood verse 3 o to grace how great a debtor daily im constrained to be let thy goodness like a fetter bind my wandering heart to thee prone to wander lord i feel it prone to leave the god i love heres my heart o take and seal it seal it for thy courts above verse 4 o that day when freed from sinning i shall see thy lovely face clothed then in bloodwashed linen how ill sing thy sovereign grace come my lord no longer tarry take my ransomed soul away send thine angels now to carry me to realms of endless day tag jesus sought me when a stranger wandering from the fold of god he to rescue me from danger interposed his precious blood tag b interposed his precious interposed his precious interposed his precious holy blood ending
